title: Grasp acquires AirPhoton to form Grasp Global
summary: French startup Grasp SAS has acquired Baltimore, Maryland-based AirPhoton to create Grasp Global, a U.S. Earth-observation company.

title: ESA finalizes package for ministerial
summary: ESA is putting the finishing touches on a package of programs it will ask its member states to support at a council meeting in November.

title: NASA to Participate in ASCEND Conference, Brief Media on Tech Demo
summary: NASA leaders, including Deputy Administrator Pam Melroy, will participate in the 2022 ASCEND conference, hosted by the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA) in Las Vegas from Monday, Oct. 24, through Wednesday, Oct. 26.

title: Video of Starlink terminal in Iran shared on Instagram
summary: A video of a Starlink terminal in Iran was recently shared on Instagram. In September, Elon Musk and the team at SpaceX...

title: Space Force tries to turn over a new leaf in satellite procurement
summary: The Space Systems Command next year will seek industry bids for as many as four infrared sensing satellites for missile tracking from medium Earth orbit (MEO).

title: Why NASA Is Trying To Crash Land on Mars
summary: Like a car’s crumple zone, the experimental SHIELD lander is designed to absorb a hard impact.

title: Another batch of Starlink satellites launch from Cape Canaveral
summary: Fifty-four Starlink internet satellites fastened to a Falcon 9 rocket blasted off Thursday from Cape Canaveral, continuing SpaceX’s deployments for a broadband network reaching into an ever-expanding market linking rural households, ships, commercial airplanes, and Ukrainian military forces in their fight against Russia.

title: China looked at putting a monitoring satellite in retrograde geostationary orbit via the moon
summary: China appears to have considered boosting its space situational awareness capabilities by placing a satellite in a retrograde orbit out at the geostationary belt.

title: ESA moves two missions to Falcon 9
summary: The European Space Agency now plans to launch a space telescope and an asteroid mission on Falcon 9 rockets because of its loss of access to Soyuz vehicles and delays in the introduction of the Ariane 6.

title: SpaceX launches the 3,500th Starlink satellite
summary: SpaceX launched another batch of Starlink satellites to low Earth orbit (LEO) on Thursday. Liftoff occurred at 10:50 AM EDT (14:50 UTC) on Oct. 20 from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida.
